devdoc.details: Additionally incentivizes keepers with L1 rollup fees according to the Optimism spec

acceptOwner().details: Can only be called by the pending owner to ensure correctness. Calls to the `_beforeAcceptOwner` hook      to perform logic before updating ownership.

params.underlyingId: The underlying price feed id within the oracle's specific implementation

commit(bytes32[],uint256,bytes).details: Accepts both requested and non-requested versions.      Requested versions will pay out a keeper reward, non-requested versions will not.      Accepts any publish time in the underlying price message, as long as it is within the validity window,      which means its possible for publish times to be slightly out of order with respect to versions.      Batched updates are supported by passing in a list of price feed ids along with a valid batch update data.

params.ids: The list of price feed ids to commit

params.id: The id of the oracle to create

current().details: Rounded up to the nearest granularity

pause().details: Can only be called by the pauser

settle(bytes32[],address[],uint256[],uin.details: Pays out a keeper incentive if all supplied local settlement callbacks succeed      Each array must be the same length, each index is a separate corresponding callback entry

params.ids: The list of price feed ids to settle
params.markets: The list of markets to settle
params.maxCounts: The list of maximum number of settlement callbacks to perform before exiting
params.versions: The list of versions to settle

unpause().details: Can only be called by the pauser

updatePauser(address).details: Can only be called by the current owner

updatePendingOwner(address).details: Can only be called by the current owner      New owner does not take affect until that address calls `acceptOwner()`

devdoc.title: PythFactory_Optimism

acceptOwner().notice: Accepts and transfers the ownership of the contract to the pending owner

associate(bytes32,bytes32).notice: Associates an oracle id with an underlying id

authorize(address).notice: Authorizes a factory's instances to request from this factory's instances

authorized(address).notice: Returns whether a caller is authorized to request from this factory's instances

commit(bytes32[],uint256,bytes).notice: Commits the price to specified version

commitKeepConfig(uint256).notice: Returns the keep config for commit

instances(address).notice: Returns whether the instance is valid

settle(bytes32[],address[],uint256[],uin.notice: Performs a list of local settlement callbacks

settleKeepConfig().notice: Returns the keep config for settle

userdoc.notice: Optimism Kept Oracle implementation for Pyth price feeds.
